block.p: Young & Rubicam, a Madison Avenue icon that gave the world the Jell-O jingle and the numbered Excedrin headaches, ended 77 years of independence by agreeing to a $5.7 billion takeover by the WPP Group, a rival based in London. Executives of the companies were expected to announce the deal today. The takeover, which ends four months of talks, would make WPP the largest advertising company in the world. Article, Page C1.
